sentences.en: At first he was bashful about the notoriety which the newspaper caused.
sentences.cn: 最初他对报纸给他引起的狼藉名声感到很害羞.

sentences.en: Because of he does not answer it, he feel bashful.
sentences.cn: 他因回答不出而感到羞愧难当.

sentences.en: Don't be bashful — speak up for yourself.
sentences.cn: 别害羞——你有话说出来啊.

sentences.en: Don’t be bashful about telling people how you feel.
sentences.cn: 不要羞于说出自己的感受。

sentences.en: He because of bashful but low head.

sentences.cn: 他看起来腼腆且局促不安。

sentences.en: Little Joe, almost three years old, turned bashful and hid behind Lucy's skirt.
sentences.cn: 快到三岁的乔腼腆地藏到露西的裙子后面.

sentences.en: Maybe Robert Kincaid would just leave. He seemed pretty quiet, nice enough, even a little bashful.
sentences.cn: 也许罗伯特.金凯就此走了, 他看起来挺安静, 挺和善, 甚至有点腼腆.

sentences.en: No! That Margaret could not do. That was expecting too great a sacrifice of bashful feeling.
sentences.cn: 不! 玛格丽脱决不肯这样做. 这太羞人了.

sentences.en: Out with it. Don't be bashful.
sentences.cn: 有话快说, 别扭扭捏捏的.

sentences.en: She is always bashful among strangers.
sentences.cn: 她和生人在一起,总是忸忸怩怩.

sentences.en: She is bashful in doing [ to do ] anything.
The girl betrayed in her smile and half - averted looks the bashful tenderness of her sex.
sentences.cn: 从这位姑娘那微笑和斜睇的眼睛里流露出女性的娇羞和温柔.

sentences.en: We all know you to be a very bashful man.
sentences.cn: 我们都知道你是个脸皮薄的人.

words.tran_cn: 羞怯地；易窘迫地；局促不安地

trans.tran_cn: 羞怯的，局促不安的，缺乏自信的，羞羞答答，忸怩
